abstract: The president called to congratulate him, but had said something that Speaker John A. Boehner said he had to respond to.
snippet: The president called to congratulate him, but had said something that Speaker John A. Boehner said he had to respond to.
lead_paragraph: President Obama called Speaker John A. Boehner on Thursday to congratulate him on the passage of long-stalled free trade agreements with South Korea, Colombia and Panama. But something else the president said rang in Mr. Boehner's ears - that Republicans had offered no real alternative to Mr. Obama's $447 billion job creation plan - and the speaker then tried to set the record straight.

headline.main: Obama's Call to Boehner Goes Off Message
